item.title: What to Expect From The Sims 4's Nature's Calling Event
item.description:
EA has released a new summer-themed roadmap for The Sims 4 , outlining releases planned for the next few months. Roadmaps for The Sims 4 are released quarterly, but this one is a precursor to Q2's roadmap. The roadmap, titled Sim Your Summer , showcases an upcoming Sims Livestream, the reveal of the roadmap on June 5, the release of The Sims Board Game , and several updates for The Sims FreePlay .

Not mentioned in the roadmap is an upcoming event, The Sims 4 Nature's Calling , which was announced in a blog post on EA's site. Events in The Sims 4 are limited-time events that usually run between four and six weeks. Players can claim login rewards and complete quests for points, which unlock rewards such as Build and Buy Mode items, traits, special potions, and Aspiration Points. These rewards can only be purchased with points earned during The Sims 4 Nature's Calling Event , so players have a small window to earn them.

How The Sims 4 Nature's Calling Event Will Work

The Nature's Calling Event will begin on June 24 and run for four weeks until August 5. Two weeks have been added to this time as a grace period for Simmers who start late, giving the event a total runtime of six weeks. Simmers will need to complete two Quests each week to earn all the available rewards. Players will need to log in with their EA account and will automatically get the new Reclaimed Woodworking Table. All rewards are linked with the player's EA account, minimizing the chances of losing them. Each week features the following announced rewards:

Week 1

  • Reclaimed Woodworking Table
  • Odonata Glasses (glasses based on the wings of a dragonfly)
  • Reclaimed Wood Wall
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #1

Week 2

  • Reclaimed Wood Dining Chair woodworking recipe
  • Flowing Fronds Swimwear
  • Foraged Feast food recipe
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #2

Week 3

  • Nature Soundscapes radio station
  • Reclaimed Wood Dining Table woodworking recipe
  • Rings of Growth tattoo
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #3

Week 4

  • The Wooden Throne outhouse
  • Cove Stones decorative rocks
  • Trail Sandals
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #4

The Sims 4 Nature's Calling Event Theme

The theme of Nature's Calling is all about venturing into the outdoors, woodworking, and discovering a secret in nature. Simmers can expect to level up their Woodworking skill with the new Woodworking table login reward, while venturing into the outdoors to discover a magical secret. It's unknown how these two elements will connect, but it may have to be necessary to unlock the secret of the voice Sims will hear during the event.

Players who keep up with any The Sims 4 leaks may note that this event theme is very closely aligned to the leaked details of the next The Sims 4 expansion pack, which is allegedly based around nature and fairies. The description of the event states:

"One fateful day, you hear a faint voice as you step outside. The voice is fleeting and is soon gone, as if carried away by the wind itself. Still, you long to hear it again, and so you journey forth to discover the source of the whispers."

This heavily hints at something magical hiding in the outdoors, and which could be the leaked fairies for The Sims 4 . Additionally, some of the rewards, notably the Odonata Glasses and Flowing Fronds Swimwear, resemble fairy wings.

While the patterns are officially based on the pattern of a dragonfly's wing, which matches the nature theme, it is also reminiscent of the pattern of The Sims 3 's fairy wings. As the event is expected to take place several weeks after the reveal of the official roadmap for June to August, it's likely Simmers will play the event in a very different context, and have a lot to look forward to.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games With Very Few Limitations, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games offer limitless player freedom and personal narrative experiences within expansive environments.
  • Dying world settings create atmospheres of loneliness and danger, enhancing immersion in open-world gaming.
  • Embrace chaos and creativity in open-world games like Goat Simulator 3 for hilarious, unpredictable fun.

Open-world games have always been known for removing limits on player environment, delivering an expansive landscape to explore and a world full of emotional stories that are among the best in gaming. The lack of limits in a giant area really allows players to play how they want to and carve out their place in the narrative in their own personal way.

Some games remove all world borders and let players roam endlessly, while others focus on giving in to as many insane mechanics as they can to encourage as much creativity and imagination as possible. Whatever the case, it is always a blast to jump into an enormous sandbox and really push the limits and go further than anyone has before.

8 Goat Simulator 3

Ridiculous Open-Ended Fun

Goat Simulator 3
7 /10
8.5 /10
Released
November 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
7 /10
8.5 /10

ESRB
t
Powered by

Goat Simulator 3 embraces chaos with a fully interactive world designed for experimentation and absurdity. There are no traditional rules or objectives beyond what the player chooses to pursue, and the world reacts to nearly every action thanks to the wide variety of unlockable abilities and physics-driven events that create limitless unpredictability.

Its open-ended nature is supported by a sandbox design that encourages exploration and playfulness in a way that feels just as rewarding as it does hilarious. Despite its humorous tone, the lack of constraints fosters a genuine sense of freedom, allowing for spontaneous creativity rarely seen in conventional open-world titles.

7 The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

The World Is A Canvas To Build On And Discover

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
46
9.2 /10
Released
May 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated E for Everyone 10+ for Fantasy Violence and Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom elevates open-world design and builds on the success of Breath of the Wild through its seamless environmental traversal and unrestricted problem-solving mechanics. The world extends from deep underground to the skies above, allowing players to glide, climb, and construct their own traversal tools to reach any destination in sight.

Plenty of mechanics introduce dynamic interactions with the environment, transforming ordinary objects into functional inventions that can be used for a host of different and creative purposes. Objectives can be approached from countless angles, and players are rewarded for lateral thinking in a way that few games can match. Its level of physical interactivity and sandbox creativity creates a sense of immersion in a world that is both expertly crafted and stunningly beautiful.

6 Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord

A True Medieval Simulator

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord
8.0 /10
Released
October 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Violence
Powered by

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord offers a dynamic Medieval world where players begin as nameless wanderers and rise to power through military conquest and political dominance. The sandbox world evolves in real-time, with factions warring, kingdoms falling, and trade routes shifting in response to player actions to deliver an experience that constantly shifts with every move.

The absence of a fixed narrative allows for a personalized experience built around strategic decisions. Sieges and large-scale battles are fully integrated into a living world simulation where the only limit is the player's own ambition. Bannerlord excels not through scripted quests, but through systems that respond organically to invention and tactical imagination.

5 Grand Theft Auto 5

The Gold Standard For Modern Open-World Games

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
135
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
135
8.9 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Grand Theft Auto 5 is the peak of modern open-world gaming, transporting players into a life-sized city with crime and action around every corner. The game can truly be played however the player chooses, and with the addition of multiplayer content and mod support, even if the base game somehow isn't enough, there is an unlimited amount of extra content that would take a lifetime to fully cover.

The classic GTA formula is elevated to new heights where every encounter and mission feels intuitive and impactful, no matter the outcome. Los Santos is a city that invites players to immerse themselves fully in a realistic sandbox, one that doesn't take itself too seriously and always prioritizes fun over fact.

4 Just Cause 4

Grapple Hooks Into Wingsuits For Pure Chaotic Action

Just Cause 4
7.0 /10
Released
December 4, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Just Cause 4 puts all the power a player could ever want right in the palm of their hands and grants them abilities they could only ever dream of having in reality. Insane movement combinations and a bombastic physics engine that pushes the explosions to their limit, every moment and every scene feels like an action movie.

Of course, some objectives and a story are built into the action, but the real draw is the game's insane mechanics and the ability to truly engage with the world and the enemies however the player wants. Whether launching a group of soldiers sky-high or appreciating the surroundings at high speed while gliding, everything feels fun and awesome at all times.

3 No Man's Sky

An Entire Universe Just Waiting To Be Explored

No Man's Sky
7 /10
49
9.1 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
7 /10
49
9.1 /10

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Animated Blood
Powered by

No Man's Sky is any sci-fi fan's dream. An entire procedurally generated universe full of planets just waiting to be explored, covered in creatures and minerals of all kinds, in a game that begs the question: "Where next?" Every landing on a new world is a breath of fresh air, and even if the surroundings aren't that appealing, it's only one short flight to the next destination.

The ability to set up a base wherever, and then leave it behind in search of a better view, means that the player is never tied down to a specific location for too long. Instead, they are given all the tools they need to become the galactic explorers they want to be in a universe that literally knows no bounds.

2 Elite Dangerous

A Player-Driven Universe That Has A Lifetime Of Content

Elite Dangerous
7.5 /10
Released
December 16, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Drug Reference, Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Elite Dangerous simulates the Milky Way galaxy on a 1:1 scale, granting players control of a spacecraft with the freedom to choose any path they want and explore however they wish. The economy, faction control, and political influence are all driven by player actions and alliances, and with the latest expansion, players can now step off their ships and explore in first-person, adding a whole new level to the already limitless world.

The lack of a predefined path creates a truly emergent gameplay environment. Space travel, planetary landings, mining, and combat all unfold within systems governed by real-time data and physics. The sheer magnitude and scale of the world is often overwhelming, and the amount of system depth and mechanical complexity is about as endless as the universe itself.

1 Minecraft

The Very Definition Of A Sandbox

6 Images
6 Images
Minecraft
151
8.9 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Minecraft is peak limitless gameplay. It is a blocky world with no end, except for the dimensions, and the freedom to craft and build whatever and however the player wants. The basic gameplay loop almost always begins in the same primitive way but quickly evolves into large-scale mining expeditions and enormous builds on a scale that is only limited by the player's imagination.

Beating the game in the conventional sense becomes a secondary objective behind the joy that comes from exploring the world and continuing to expand out into the open landscape. Every block placed represents a step forward, and in a world that continues to grow with every update, it's no wonder players have been jumping in for well over a decade with no sign of stopping any time soon.

item.title: Nintendo Offers Higher Margins to Japanese Retailers in Switch 2 Push
item.description:
Summary

  • Nintendo Switch 2 sold at low wholesale price to Japan retailers to ensure successful launch.
  • Japanese retailers to make 5% gross margin on each Switch 2 sale.
  • Switch 2 Japan model cheaper at $350, region-locked with Japanese language support.

The Nintendo Switch 2 is reportedly being sold at a low wholesale price to Japanese retail stores. This is one of several moves that Nintendo has taken to ensure that the Nintendo Switch 2 will have a successful domestic launch.

As the birthplace of Nintendo and many of the worlds other largest video game companies, Japan holds a special place in the wider gaming industry. The original Switch was hugely successful in Japan and it looks like Nintendo is trying to replicate that popularity with its successor console.

According to a recent article from Bloomberg, Nintendo is making the wholesale price of the Switch 2 relatively low for Japanese retailers so that stores will make more profit by selling the system. Typically, theres about a 2% gross margin on game consoles, but stores will reportedly make a 5% gross on each Switch 2 sale. This provides extra incentive for major Japanese retailers to advertise the console more heavily in their brick-and-mortar stores.

Nintendo Switch 2 is Getting Special Treatment in Japan

In most regions of the world, the Switch 2 will retail at around $450 USD. There will be a cheaper Switch 2 model sold in Japan, however, with the caveat that it will be region-locked and only support Japanese language accounts. The Japan-exclusive version of the console will sell for 49,980, which when converted is closer to $350. This is yet another piece of evidence that Nintendo is going out of its way to create favorable conditions for the Switch 2s release in its native country.

Video game systems are not highly profitable products, either for the retail stores or for the console manufacturers themselves. Instead, they are sold at a low margin to create as large of an install base as possible. That way, future software offerings and peripherals will have a bigger pool of customers to market to. The Switch 1 had a notoriously large install base, which allowed for a diverse range of games to do well on the system.

Many of Nintendos long-running series achieved a much greater level of success on the Switch than they did on any previous console. Titles such as The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Animal Crossing: New Horizons , and Super Smash Bros. Ultimate are all the highest-selling games in their respective franchises. Its not just big-name series that got a boost on Switch, though. The systems healthy customer base enabled some relatively niche Nintendo IPs to break through and receive an unprecedented amount of mainstream attention. Metroid Dread, Fire Emblem: Three Houses , and Pikmin 4 created many new fans in franchises that had often been seen as cult classics before this console generation.

item.title: Best Looking Turn-Based RPGs, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Tabletop RPGs inspired stunning RPG video games like Final Fantasy 7 with rich lore and characters.
  • Evolution in animation and art led to visually impressive RPGs like Divinity: Original Sin 2 and Baldur's Gate 3.
  • Games like Sea of Stars and Chrono Trigger continue the tradition of visually impressive turn-based RPGs.

Role-playing games with turn-based combat existed in tabletop form before they became video games. Many stunning adventures have been brought to life thanks to the evolution of these lore-rich and character-building games when they appeared on consoles and computers.

The evolution of motion capture animation and the resurgence of hand-painted games have given players some of the best-looking RPGs , not only in terms of setting, but also characters and other details, like spells, weapons, and gear. Not all of these gorgeous games are recent releases either; some of the most visually impressive games are also vintage classics.

7 Final Fantasy 7

A Classic That's Still Gorgeous

Final Fantasy 7
18
8.6 /10
Released
January 31, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Powered by

Final Fantasy 7 was a legend even in its own time for the amazing visuals, compelling storyline, and lovable characters. The 2020 remake was equally well-received, and is the first in a trilogy of remastered games also focused on the events and heroes of FF7 .

The previous games in this franchise weren't as visceral or realistic, and FF7 raised the bar for graphics and story considerably. Several of the featured characters have earned their places in video game history, and are recognized even by people who don't play the games. Cloud and Sephiroth are one of the most famous hero-and-villain dichotomies of all time, and both appear in other video games in the franchise.

6 Divinity: Original Sin 2

A Stunning Project From Larian Studios

Divinity: Original Sin 2
8.6 /10
Released
September 14, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Larian Studios
Powered by

Welcome to the medieval fantasy world of Rivellon, where the Godwoken have to fight the Source to gain enough strength and experience to fight the Voidwoken. The plot includes all the magic, mayhem, gore, and intrigue of any RPG, plus it has the beautiful visuals of the setting along with the Void. On a more detailed level, the weapon and combat options also look great.

Considering how expensive this game looks, it is always impressive to hear that it was crowdfunded to the tune of a mere 2 million dollars. In addition to how great it is visually, it's also considered to be one of history's greatest turn-based RPGs.

5 Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous

The Second In An Impressive Series From Owlcat

Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
September 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
8 /10
9.0 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Owlcat Games
Powered by

Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous is the second in a series of games that takes place in yet another medieval fantasy world. The country of Mendev is plagued by a magical chasm known as the Worldwound, and only the protagonist can close it using their mythic powers.

The medieval depiction of lofty castles and country roads already looks great, but what's really stunning about WotR is the depiction of the various characters, especially the protagonist, according to the class they've chosen. Zombies, dragons, demons, and even a lich are some of the many forms the hero can take, and they each have a unique design.

4 Sea of Stars

A Brilliant Play Of Color And Light

Sea of Stars
9.0 /10
Released
August 29, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Sabotage
Powered by

Sea of Stars was launched fairly recently, but it uses the same kind of pixel graphics as the old-school console games from the 1990s. This is an intended part of the design. Pixel art with modern tweaking and color looks amazing, which was part of the intention of the designers.

The view is the familiar isometric setting that is used by most turn-based RPGs, and takes advantage of the view to use both vintage and modern visuals. The player controls a hero called a Solstice Warrior as they fight their way through the world by solving puzzles and fighting enemies.

3 Chrono Trigger

The Pinnacle Of Vintage Gameplay And Design

Chrono Trigger
20
9.8 /10
Released
March 11, 1995

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Powered by

Chrono Trigger might be the title that made turn-based video games a genre of their own in the mid-1990s. Modern games still use their unique style and appealing design as an inspiration for their own fantasy-based RPGs, with Sea of Stars being one of the most popular and recent examples.

The designers who created Chrono-Trigger are three of the most talented in the business, which explains its enduring success. Hironobu Sakaguchi is the creator of the Final Fantasy series, Akira Toriyama designed the Dragon Quest characters and wrote the Dragon Ball manga series, and Yuji Horii is the creator of the original Dragon Quest video games.

2 Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

An Ethereal And Elegant Aesthetic

10 Images
10 Images
Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
94
9.3 /10
Released
April 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Sandfall Interactive
Powered by

La Belle poque was a time in French history when designers and artists flourished, and the setting of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is based on a dark fantasy version of this same environment. The production studio, Sandfall, intended to create a high-fidelity turn-based game and was inspired by JRPGs like Persona and Final Fantasy .

The number in the title comes from the maximum age of the characters in this world. They can only live until 32, and are executed when they reach 33 in a mass sacrifice called the Grommage. This event is overseen by the big boss, a villain named the Paintress, who is also a type of artist.

1 Baldur's Gate 3

The Best Of Motion Capture And VA Talent

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
131
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
9 /10
131
9.7 /10

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Larian Studios
Powered by

Baldur's Gate 3 was released almost two years ago, and since then, the game's fanbase and popularity have remained consistent. Larian Studios, the same company behind Divinity: Original Sin 2, is also responsible for this masterpiece, and the gaming world is looking forward to what they do next.

The recent release of a patch that included new subclasses was just as well-received, and includes some new visuals to complement them. The settings and characters of BG3 look great already, and the addition of a few more creative attacks and spells makes it even better.

item.title: Fallout 3 Companions Tier List
item.description:
Fallout 3 is considered by many to be an iconic installment in the Fallout series, as it marked a huge turning point for the future of the franchise. Bethesda took over from Interplay Entertainment as the developer, and the series moved on from 2D graphics and turn-based combat to real-time combat and 3D renders of the characters and the environment.

This shift helped bring Fallout 3 s characters to life, particularly the Lone Wanderer and his companions. These companions have always been a crucial part of the Fallout experience, as they provide support in combat, enhance gameplay, and add depth to the narrative. However, not all companions are created equal, and players' choice of companions varies based on their preferred qualities. Some companions stand out from the rest of the horde based on their abilities, combat effectiveness, and overall utility.

S-Tier Fallout 3 Companions

  • Fawkes
  • Charon

Fawkes and Charon are regarded as some of the best companions in Fallout 3 , largely due to their combat capabilities. Despite being a super mutant, Fawkes is well known for his heart of gold, making him the perfect companion for players who maintain Good Karma during their playthroughs. Equipped with an extra helping of health, strength, and Gatling gun (which boasts a killer DPS), Fawkes is considered the most complete companion for combat. His carry capacity is also unrivaled, and the difficulty of unlocking Fawkes as a companion is justified by the value he brings to the table.

On the other hand, Fallout 3 's Charon famously lacks a moral compass, so players are free to explore neutral or evil playthrough options. The ghoul is only loyal to his master and will carry out any task to protect their interest regardless of the player's karma. In terms of combat, Charon's versatile hybrid of stealth and explosive gameplay makes him a favorite.

A-Tier Fallout 3 Companions

  • Dogmeat
  • Star Paladin Cross
  • Sergeant RL-3

Dogmeat, the iconic canine companion, is Fallout 3 s rendition of mans best friend. While not the most powerful in terms of combat, Dogmeats ability to find hidden items, fun nature, loyalty, and overall resilience endear him to players, especially early in the game. However, due to Dogmeats inadequate contribution on the offensive end, players can select a more advanced lifeform as a second companion to form a group of three.

Sergeant RL-3 and Star Paladin Cross are more suited to combat, each with heavy weaponry of their own. Cross shines more against super mutants and other heavily armored foes, and her strong moral compass means she's also best suited for good karma playthroughs.

Sarges militaristic personality provides some amusing dialogue, with his only drawback being a lack of nimbleness and agility in tight spaces. However, his sheer offensive firepower and value as a tank are more than enough compensation.

B-Tier Fallout 3 Companions

  • Jericho
  • Clover

Since their identities are closely tied to an evil playthrough, Jericho and Clover can only be acquired with Evil Karma. Jericho is a grizzled ex-raider with a love for violence, murder, and alcohol. He stands out early in the game with his abrasive and unappealing personality, and players who do not mind pursuing a darker storyline tend to gravitate toward him.

Despite his limited appeal, Jericho is a skilled combatant and a top-tier marksman with a rifle, making him a good companion for players who tend to get into dogfights. Clover is loyal as a slave and starts as one of the best companions in terms of carrying capacity. However, she soon becomes obsolete when leveling, and her reliance on melee combat means keeping her alive when the going gets tough is difficult.

C-Tier Fallout 3 Companions

  • Butch DeLoria

Partnering with the Tunnel Snakes leader is more about nostalgia than utility. Butch is quite accessible and can be recruited after completing a specific quest. While he has a unique character arc and some humorous dialogue, his combat effectiveness is average at best as it does not scale as well late into the game compared to others. He also severely lacks health points, making him one of the weaker companions.
